langdetect

Class NGram

  • java.lang.Object
    • langdetect.NGram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<NGram>

    public class NGram
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<NGram>
    This class represents a n-gram, which is a n-character slice of a text. It stores the characters defining the n-gram and two integers indicating the number of occurrences of the n-gram in a text and its position in the text's frequency profile.
    Author:
    Tobias Falke

      • NGram

        public NGram(java.lang.String ngram)
        Creates a new n-gram for the given string of characters. The count is initialized to 1 and now position is stored yet (-1).

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(NGram o)
        Compares this n-gram to another n-gram. Returns -1, if this n-gram has a higher number of occurrences, 1, if the other has a higher number, and 0, if both have the same. Thus, with this comparison, n-grams can be sorted in reverse-order of occurrence.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<NGram>
